newsitem.title: CHINA: China inflation seen rising in Q3 1996.
newsitem.headline: China inflation seen rising in Q3 1996.

text.p: China's retail price inflation will probably rise in the third quarter of 1996 because of higher prices for grain, crude oil, transportation and electricity, the Business News said on Saturday.
It estimated that third quarter retail price inflation will be an annual 7.9 percent over the same 1995 period, an increase of 1.3 percentage points over the second quarter of 1996.

The rise would mainly reflect increases in the state purchasing price of grain and urban grain selling prices and higher prices for crude oil, rail transportation and electricity for domestic use, it said.
A large number of inefficient companies were another negative factor, pushing up production costs, it said.
The government target for retail price inflation in 1996 is 10 percent, down from an actual 14.8 percent in 1995.
